summaryText: Wow, what an incredible message from Pastor Montell Jordan about embracing faith for your future! Today's sermon was a powerful reminder that your past, pain, opinions of others, financial status, or current position do not define who you are in Christ. Pastor Montell shared five transformative steps to increase your faith: don't let your past define you, don't allow your pain to control you, don't let people's opinions limit you, don't let money determine your worth, and don't be trapped by your current position. Through personal stories and scriptural wisdom, he demonstrated how God can turn our biggest challenges into our most powerful testimonies. Can you imagine going from an R&B artist and unfaithful husband to a pastor working alongside his wife to help other marriages? That's the redemptive power of God! Pastor Montell's message wasn't just about personal transformation, but about understanding that when we come into relationship with Jesus, everything changes. The most powerful moment came when he invited someone to accept Christ, reminding us that our eternal destination is more important than anything we experience on earth.
mainPoints: Your past does not define your future
Eternal salvation is more important than earthly success

versesMentioned.text: Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come: The old has gone, the new is here!
'For I know the plans I have for you,' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.'
The Lord is close to the brokenhearted and saves those who are crushed in spirit.
For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
Many are the plans in a person's heart, but it is the Lord's purpose that prevails.
Let everyone be subject to the governing authorities, for there is no authority except that which God has established. The authorities that exist have been established by God.

Monday.scripture: Jeremiah 29:11: 'For I know the plans I have for you,' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.'
Monday.focus: Recognizing God's intentional plans for your life
Monday.action: Write down three areas where you feel stuck or defined by your past. Pray over each one, asking God to show you His perspective and potential.
Monday.prayer: Heavenly Father, help me see myself through Your eyes. Reveal the plans You have for me and give me courage to step into the future You've prepared. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 5:17: 'Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come: The old has gone, the new is here!'
Tuesday.focus: Embracing your new identity in Christ
Tuesday.action: Create a list of your old identity versus your new identity in Christ. Meditate on who God says you are, not who you used to be.
Tuesday.prayer: Lord Jesus, thank You for making me new. Help me fully embrace my identity in You and walk in the freedom You've given me. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Psalm 34:18: 'The Lord is close to the brokenhearted and saves those who are crushed in spirit.'
Wednesday.action: Journal about a painful experience, but focus on how God has been present and healing in that situation. Identify one way you've grown through the challenge.
Wednesday.prayer: God of healing, touch the broken places in my heart. Help me see how You've been working in my pain and transform my wounds into wisdom. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Proverbs 3:5-6: 'Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight.'
Thursday.focus: Trusting God's guidance over human opinions
Thursday.action: Identify one area where you've been overly influenced by others' opinions. Spend time in prayer asking God to reveal His true direction.
Thursday.prayer: Father, help me tune out voices that don't align with Your truth. Give me discernment to hear Your voice clearly. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Matthew 6:21: 'For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.'
Friday.action: Review your recent expenses. Identify one area where you can redirect resources to align more closely with God's kingdom purposes.
Friday.prayer: Lord, help me steward my resources wisely. Show me how to invest in eternal things rather than temporary pleasures. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Romans 8:28: 'And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.'
Saturday.action: Reflect on a past challenge and write down how God might have been working in that situation. Share your story of transformation with someone.
Saturday.prayer: Heavenly Father, thank You for Your ability to work all things together for good. Help me trust Your process and share Your redemptive work. Amen.
